intro: Cassinia telfordii, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cassinia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that are clustered in heads. Cassinia telfordii is often used in native gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
